src:
Bos Bukalapak Buka-bukaan Modal Awal: Tak Sampai Jutaan Rupiah
03 Nov 2019, 00:36 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Siapa sangka situs e-commerce Bukalapak yang baru saja mendapat pendanaan dari anak usaha bank asal Korea Selatan, Shinhan GIB, itu, hanya punya modal awal tak sampai jutaan rupiah?
Soal ini, Muhammad Fajrin Rasyid, Co-Founder dan President Bukalapak bercerita panjang lebar. Di hadapan ratusan mahasiswa yang hadir, Fajrin pun buka-bukaan bagaimana sebenarnya modal awal Bukalapak hingga tumbuh menjadi unicorn.
"Buat yang nanya 'Berapa sih modal Bukalapak?' Itu sangat sangat kecil, nggak sampai jutaan rupiah," ujar Fajrin di acara talkshow Jogja Startup Day 2019 di Universitas Amikom Yogyakarta 2 November 2019.
Fajrin merinci modal mereka bertiga saat itu terutama hanya laptop bekas yang dipakai saat masih kuliah bersama di kampus Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB). Uang yang dikeluarkan saat itu hanya untuk beli domain dan sejenisnya. "Untuk bikin startup awal (versi desktop) ya butuh waktunya cuma dua sampai tiga bulan saja," ujarnya.
Setelah startup awal Bukalapak jadi, ujar Fajrin, bersama kedua rekannya hanya merekrut dua sampai tiga orang untuk membantu mengenalkan dan memasarkan produk mereka. "Jadi bisa dikira-kira, berapa sebenarnya modal awal Bukalapak," ujarnya. Hanya saja yang membedakan, startegi Bukalapak saat itu membangun mitra atau mencari pelapak pelapak yang mau mengisi startup-nya.
Valuasi unicorn Tanah Air itu pun kini sudah mencapai lebih dari US$ 2,5 miliar atau sekitar Rp 35 triliun. Fajrin menuturkan saat ini dari situs yang ia bangun tahun 2010 silam bersama dua rekan kampusnya, Achmad Zaky dan Nugroho Herucahyono itu juga telah mempekerjakan lebih dari 2.000 karyawan.
Fajrin mengklaim, omset rata rata pelapak di Bukalapak setiap tahun naik tiga kali lipat. Bukalapak sendiri menurutnya kini menjadi rumah bagi 5 juta pelapak yang sebagian besar kelompok usaha mikro kecil menengah (UMKM). "(Capaian) Bukalapak ini seperti yang kami harapkan sejak awal, yakni memberi dampak positif bagi UMKM di Indonesia.
text:
Bukalapak Boss Opens Up Initial Capital: Not Up to Millions of Rupiah
03 Nov 2019, 00:36 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Who would have thought the Bukalapak e-commerce site, which had just received funding from a South Korean bank subsidiary, Shinhan GIB, only had initial capital of less than millions of rupiah?
Regarding this matter, Muhammad Fajrin Rasyid, Co-Founder and President of Bukalapak told a long story. In front of the hundreds of students present, Fajrin was open about how the initial capital of Bukalapak actually grew to become a unicorn.
"For those who ask 'How much is Bukalapak's capital?' That is very, very small, not up to millions of rupiah, "Fajrin said at the Jogja Startup Day 2019 talkshow at Yogyakarta Amikom University on November 2, 2019.
Fajrin detailed the capital of the three of them at that time, especially only used laptops when they were still studying together at the Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB) campus. The money spent at that time was only to buy domains and the like. "To make an initial startup (desktop version), it only takes two to three months," he said.
After the initial startup Bukalapak became, said Fajrin, together with his two colleagues only recruited two to three people to help introduce and market their products. "So it can be estimated, how much is the initial capital of Bukalapak," he said. It's just that distinguishes, Bukalapak strategy at that time to build partners or find a pelapak pelapak who wants to fill his startup.
The country's unicorn valuation has now reached more than US $ 2.5 billion or around Rp 35 trillion. Fajrin said that currently from the site that he had built in 2010 together with his two campus colleagues, Achmad Zaky and Nugroho Herucahyono, he also had more than 2,000 employees.
Fajrin claimed, the average turnover of pelapak in Bukalapak every year tripled. According to him, Bukalapak is now home to 5 million pelapak, most of which are micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). "(Achievements) This Bukalapak was as we had hoped from the beginning, which had a positive impact on MSMEs in Indonesia.
